CatDescriptText: Mrs. Julia Gordon, 815-1/2 Pennsylvania Avenue, Coraopolis, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 31, 1958, pg. A1 question reads: "Do you think people follow political leadership more than religious leadership? Why?" answer reads: "I think that the politician has the most influence.  The minister of today, well, the people just don't look up to him.  The minister is no more than you and I in the thinking of the people today.  They just don't have the confidence of the people."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Julia Gordon, wearing earrings, scarf, and light colored coat, holding striped box in right hand, standing on Liberty Avenue with May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
